title: Sugar Cookies
directions: Mix powdered sugar, margarine, egg, vanilla & almond extract. Mix in flour, baking soda & cream of tartar. Cover & refrigerate at least 2 hours. Heat Oven to 375 bake 7-8 min. until edges are brown.

title: Taco soup
ingredients: 1 can per person Kidney beans, undrained
directions: Brown the ground beef and chopped onion together. Drain and add the tomatoes and tomato sauce, adding water to desired thickness. Then add the beans and seasoning. Let simmer for 20 minutes or more (the longer the thicker). Put desired amount of chips ( corn or tortilla) in a bowl pour soup over top with grated cheese, tomatoes, avocados, lettuce. Also good mixed with mac and cheese.

title: No bake Cookies - Gma Dixon
directions: Place in a large pan and boil for 1 ½ minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add 3 cups. Quick Oats, 1 tsp Vanilla. Drop on Wax paper. Cool Completely. Makes about 40.

title: Boil Raisin Cake
directions: Combine and boil sugar, shortening,raisins, soda, salt, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and water together. Let Cool, then in a 9 x 13 pan add flour, baking soda, soda vanilla, and nuts together and bake at 350 deg until toothpick comes out clean.

title: Easy Penuche Icing
directions: Melt butter and stir in Brown sugar. Boil and stir over low heat for 2 min. Stir in milk and boil. Let Cool then Stir in powdered sugar.

title: Christmas Jello
directions: In a 9 x 13 pan drain and add the pineapple. Make the lime jello as instructed on the package, then pour over the pineapple. Stir then let the jello set. Make the lemon jello next with 1 ½ cups of boiling water, 4 oz. Cream cheese softened, and milk. Mix and let set. Make the Strawberry jello with 1 cup boiling water and cranberries then pour over the lemon layer and let set. Top with 4 oz cream cheese softened mixed with 4 oz of coolwhip.

title: Chex Muddy Buddies
directions: Pour Chex into a large bowl, set aside. In 1 quart microwave safe bowl combine the chocolate chips, peanut butter, and margarine then microwave on high for 1 to 1 ½ minutes  or until smooth. Stir in the vanilla. Pour the chocolate mixture over the cereal, stirring until all pisces are evenly coated. POur  cereal into a large ziplock bag with powdered sugar. Seal securely and shake until all pisces are well coated.

title: Cookie-Jar Gingersnaps
directions: Sift dry ingredients together. Cream the shortening and sugar. Add Egg and molasses Beat until fluffy. Sift in dry ingredients and blend well. Roll teaspoon of dough in hands and cover with granulated sugar. Place 2 inch's apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 deg until the tops are crackly and light brown, about 12-15min. Do not overbake. Cool and store in airtight containers. Makes about 4 doz. Cookies.

title: Peanut Brittle
directions: Heat and stir Sugar, syrup, and 1 cup water in a 3qrt pan till sugar dissolves. Cook over medium heat to a soft boil(234 deg). Add nuts and 1/2 tsp. Salt. Cook to a hard crack stage (305 deg) stirring often. Remove from heat and quickly stir in peanut butter and soda. Pour onto 2 well-buttered 15 1/2 by 10 ½ by 1 in pans, spread with a spatula . Spread thin with a fork and break up when the candy is cold..

title: Old Fashioned Molasses Cookies
directions: In a large bowl, stir together oil, molasses, and 1 cup sugar until smooth. In another bowl, stir together dry ingredients. Gradually add moist mixture, and stir to combine. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hr or until the next day. Place remaining ¼ cup sugar in a small bowl. Roll dough into ½ inch balls, covered with sugar. Place 3” apart on a cooking sheet, baking at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Transfer to a cooling rack.

title: Lime squares
directions: Beat butter and sugar in a bowl until creamy. Beat in vanilla, rind, and salt. Beat in flour until dough forms. With floured fingers pat dough into a 9X9X2 pan lined with foil and buttered. Bake at 350 deg for about 40 min or until golden. Start preparing the topping by stirring together the sugar, lime juice, eggs, flour, lime rind, baking powder, and food coloring. Mix until very smooth, then pour over the crust. Bake for 15-20 min. Cool on a wire rack. Cool completely before lifting the foil from the pan. Cut into 2X2 squares. Decorate each square with cherry and green icing leaf if desired.

title: Basic Sweet Dough
directions: Heat Together milk,shortening, sugar, and salt water, Add 2 cups flour to the milk mixture. Add egg and mix. Add the rest of the flour and knead to a soft, pliable, almost sticky Dough. Let Raise in oiled Bowl until it's doubled in size. Punch down and knead air bubbles out. Roll for cinnamon rolls or buns (you may add chocolate chips , candied fruit and or nuts to dough). Place on a greased Pan. Let raise then bake at 400 deg until brown. Then frost with my favorite icing.

title: Banana Bread
directions: Cream the butter with sugar. Add the egg and bananas then mix well. Add flour, baking soda, and salt. Pour in a very greased Loaf pan. Bake at 350 deg for 1 hour.
